channel.title: R on samia.rbind.io
channel.description: Recent content in R on samia.rbind.io

item.title: Visualizing Climate Data: A Tidy Tuesday Project from January 2020 using data from the Australia Wildfires
item.description: It’s been a while since I’ve posted on this blog or have worked on a Tidy Tuesday project, so I thought I’d revisit and post the project I did in January for R4DataScience to visualize climate data during the Australia wildfires earlier this year. My heatmap visualizations were inspired by Nick Tierny’s tutorial on Github transform Australia’s Bureau of Meteorology’s heatmap data into viridis themed maps and plots. Here’s a gallery of my maps from the project:

item.title: Making a Static Website Using Blogdown
item.description: I made this website using Hugo via the blogdown package in R. Like probably many R users, I started using R for its data analysis capabilities—I never thought that I’d be making a whole website with it! I sp
